channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump threatens to derail Washington Commanders' new stadium deal over team name
item.description: President Trump said the Washington Commanders should change their name back to their former name, which many Indigenous people consider a slur. He th...

item.title: Dozens Are Killed at Aid Site Near Border, Gaza Health Officials Say
item.description: The shootings took place after thousands of Palestinians gathered in the hope of getting humanitarian aid from U.N. trucks entering the Gaza Strip.

item.title: Edwin Feulner, ‘Heritage Foundation’s George Washington,’ Dies at 83
item.description: As co-founder and longtime head of the conservative Washington think tank, he picked policies and staffers for G.O.P. presidents from Reagan to Trump.

item.title: Trump Urges Washington and Cleveland Sports Teams to Revert to Native American Names
item.description: The president threatened to block a deal for the Washington Commanders’ new stadium if the team did not bow to his demand.

item.title: Israel Kills Dozens of Palestinians Seeking Aid, Gaza Officials Say
item.description: Israeli soldiers opened fire near the Zikim crossing between the Gaza Strip and Israel, where a convoy of 25 trucks from the United Nations was enteri...

item.title: Map: Tracking Tropical Storm Wipha
item.description: See the likely path and wind arrival times for Wipha.

item.title: Canceling ‘The Late Show’ Is Bad News for Late-Night TV, not Stephen Colbert
item.description: The art form was already in decline; this may hasten its demise. But don’t fret about the host. His talents are better showcased elsewhere.

item.title: Passenger Ferry Fire Kills at Least 3 in Indonesia
item.description: At least three people were killed aboard a passenger ship after a fire broke out on Sunday morning, the authorities and local news outlets said.

item.title: Calls for Japan’s Leader to Resign as His Party Faces Election Defeat
item.description: Exit polls suggest a major loss for the Liberal Democratic Party in parliamentary elections, but Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is vowing to stay on.

item.title: Driver Crashes Into San Jose Post Office, Igniting Fire
item.description: A man was arrested in connection with the crash on suspicion of arson, officials said. No injuries were reported.

item.title: Jean-Pierre Azéma, 87, Dies; Chronicled French Collaboration With Nazis
item.description: He was among the historians who challenged national myths about the compromises his country made after being occupied by Germany in World War II.

item.title: Trump administration shuts down EPA's scientific research arm
item.description: The agency is closing the Office of Research and Development, which analyzes dangers posed by hazards including toxic chemicals, climate change, smog,...

item.title: Jake Larson, a WWII veteran who became a TikTok star as 'Papa Jake', has died at 102
item.description: Papa Jake Larson joined the US National Guard at 15 years old.

item.title: After plea deals are canceled, what happens next with the Guantanamo 9/11 trials?
item.description: Georgetown University Law professor Stephen Vladeck explains where things stand with the 9/11 Guantanamo cases now that the plea deals have been cance...

item.title: Nearly 100 people killed seeking aid in Gaza on Sunday, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed across Gaza on Sunday as they tried to get food aid, according to local health authorities, one of the deadliest da...
